title: The Urgot Decision
body:
So, there has been a little bit of hype surrounding urgot and his supposed "dark horse" role in top, but it is very apparent to me there is a critical decision you have to make in order to be successful on him.

It is a trade off due to a lack of proper itemization, so what a regular champion can get out of their first full item is more of a benefit to them than Urgot's first item. this is due to Urgot needing both damage stats and mana, especially during early game.

the trade then becomes mana/mana regen, or damage and health? these are all things that are critical to urgot, and due to manmune/muramana's slow growth nature, it inhibits Urgot's early to mid game. Don't get me wrong, once he has that and maybe a BC, he is outright dangerous... if he hasn't been utterly crippled due to his horrible early game... 

I find Item build paths to really be his weakness, I am still toying around with what I think works best, but if you get mana, you have no damage, if you get damage, you have no mana. Even after you have tear, it still leaves him mana hungry early game, and he can barely stay in lane and has such pitiful damage until he starts building AD. Mana management is critical on him, but you can't do a thing on him due to such high early game mana costs.

So currently the Urgot Decision is either mana, or damage until mid/late game where he has a decent amount of both.

So, what if Urgot had lower early game mana costs? Honestly, that is the only way I see him making a comeback in any role...
